comment1.text: I’d also recommend practicing with a friend — it makes a big difference when you get feedback!

comment2.text: I’ve been doing the same thing — one resume but I bold different sections for each job type.

comment3.text: Honestly, I just try to smile and say something specific about their talk. It’s helped me start a few conversations.

comment4.text: Also — don’t feel like you need to impress them. Just being curious and genuine goes a long way.

comment5.text: Totally agree on sleep. I tried pulling late nights during my first co-op and it backfired fast.

comment6.text: I added volunteer work and it actually started a few conversations with recruiters!

comment7.text: Ask about turnover or team collaboration — that usually tells you more than any mission statement.

comment8.text: STAR has helped me a ton too. It keeps your answers structured and confident.

comment9.text: Agreed — tailoring each one shows effort and helps you connect better with the role.

comment10.text: That’s a great tip — I once caught red flags just from how vague a manager’s answer was!
